image.altText: TowerTitmus

props.synopsis: In an exclusive insight, Dean Boxall explains the secrets within a model Eiffel Tower in Brisbane, that has helped Australia's golden start in the pool.

title.children: Hidden inside a model of the Eiffel Tower in Brisbane lies a secret that is helping Australia's golden start in Paris

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus smiles and waves to the crowd poolside

props.synopsis: There was never any doubt. There can never be a doubt. Ariarne Titmus wrote herself into the status of Olympic legend with a consummate 400m performance at the Olympic Games.

title.children: 'Normal' Arnie proves she is anything but as she cements her greatness

image.altText: Four female Australian swimmers smile and embrace at poolside after winning an Olympic gold medal.

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus claims gold after defending her 400m freestyle title in dominant fashion, Australia wins another relay title and Grace Brown triumphs on the roads of Paris.

title.children: Titmus defends her 400m title as Australia's women's relay team adds another gold to the tally

image.altText: A woman wearing yellow Tshirt holds up a poster of a man's face with MISSING PERSON text on top

props.synopsis: Tensions are building in remote northern Australia after a string of mysterious disappearances. It comes as an increasing number of Australians are reported missing.

title.children: ‘Someone knows something’: Tensions build over string of disappearances in outback towns

image.altText: People stand around a soccer field with tape around it.

props.synopsis: Israel is blaming Hezbollah in Lebanon for the strike on a soccer pitch and says it is preparing a response.

title.children: Israel says children among dead after rocket strike hits sports field in Golan Heights

image.altText: Composite image of Senators Jenny McAllister and Malarndirri McCarthy both wearing red jackets.

props.synopsis: The two senators are in line for promotion to fill vacancies created by the departures of Linda Burney and Brendan O'Connor.

title.children: Senators McCarthy and McAllister to be promoted in cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: A collage of three apartments over a graphic of the skyline with a balcony visible

props.synopsis: From tenants kicked out after decades, to no one ever moving in, these three apartment sites in Sydney help paint a picture of "inactive" or unoccupied housing across Australia.

title.children: The apartment towers with no residents looming over Sydney neighbourhoods

image.altText: Australia cyclist Grace Brown rides in the women's individual time trial at the Paris Olympic games.

props.synopsis: Not since 2004 has Australia won Olympic gold in road cycling, with Grace Brown topping the podium with a commanding performance in the women's individual time trial on the wet roads of Paris.

title.children: Grace Brown executes race plan 'to perfection' to snap 20-year drought with cycling gold

image.altText: Maddison Keeney and Anabelle Smith lack synchronicity in a dive

props.synopsis: With just one dive to go, Maddison Keeney and Anabelle Smith looked set to win Australia's first medal at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. But nothing in sport is ever guaranteed.

title.children: 'I screamed underwater': Australia made to wait for first medal in Paris after final synchro dive goes awry

image.altText: Man in grey-blue suit, without tie stands in front of a camera reporting. He is outside the White House in Washington DC.

props.synopsis: An election campaign that was mostly static before the presidential debate has transformed into one of the most volatile and consequential in more than 50 years.

title.children: I went to Washington to tap into US politics, but got much more than I bargained for

image.altText: Two women sit on grass smiling at each other, while one holds a small child.

props.synopsis: A growing number of Australian women are opting to bypass traditional fertility clinics and instead turning to unregulated Facebook groups in search of sperm donors — a practice experts say is fraught with safety risks and moral quandaries.

title.children: Searching for sperm online: The Facebook groups where babies are made under the radar

image.altText: A surfer rides a wave in front of homes beneath a lighthouse

props.synopsis: Cafe owner Phil Taylor spent 20 years in Byron Bay for its surf and vibrant lifestyle, but he's recently chosen to move closer to the city for a fraction of the price.

title.children: Byron Bay used to have a 'magic' about it — then sea changers steamrolled the locals

image.altText: A close up portrait of Miranda July who has curled auburn hair and blue eyes and is standing against a tiled wall

props.synopsis: Could it be true that midlife crises are worthy, necessary expeditions and not simply cringey, cliched self-indulgence? The central character in Miranda July's new book, All Fours, thinks so.

title.children: Midlife crises aren't all balding men in flash cars. For women, midlife can be psychedelic

image.altText: Thai royals wearing formal military uniforms walk near minders in shade in an open space outside.

props.synopsis: Thailand has the strictest lèse-majesté, or royal defamation, laws in the world and right now, they're threatening to bring down the opposition and a former prime minister.

title.children: Love royal gossip? In this country, that could land you behind bars

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: Regulators keep telling us that everything is OK and Australians are coping with surging mortgage repayments. But does the reality for many households match the soothing reports?

title.children: Do financial regulators really understand how much many Australian mortgage borrowers are struggling?

image.altText: Aami Mills

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-based business owner Aami Mills lost $10,000 to hackers after creating her own small business and using social media to advertise. Now, she's taking extra steps to protect herself, but says social media companies should do more.

title.children: Business owners urged to take precautions after woman loses $10,000 to hackers who took over her Facebook account

image.altText: Young girl with black hair wearing activewear smiles standing in front of a tree with expanse of mountains behind her.

props.synopsis: With some parents struggling to manage their young people's use of smartphones and social media, others are taking a firm position against "addictive" technology to protect teenagers' mental health.

title.children: Kids get up to 300 social media alerts a day. So these parents took matters into their own hands

image.altText: A young man shows a can to a police officer in a helmet

props.synopsis: Before there was violent protest, the National Guard and a pig nominated for office — in August 1968, the Democratic National Convention was facing the same dilemma we are now.

title.children: The last time a president decided not to run for re-election, the streets of Chicago descended into chaos

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: The first medals of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games have been handed out, with a golden start for the Aussies. Check out the full medal tally.

title.children: Here are the medal standings for Day One of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Rower Tara Rigney is rowing in a single sculls event.

props.synopsis: Australians will be competing in events including rowing, surfing, swimming and mountain biking on Day Two of the Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule Day Two: Matildas and De Minaur in action as busy swimming schedule continues

image.altText: GettyImages-2163962092

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus joins Dawn Fraser as the only female Australian swimmer to defender an Olympic title, with a stunning swim in Paris.

title.children: 'I'm buggered': Titmus creates Australian Olympics history, as relay team wins gold and sets new record

image.altText: A man's face in front of a set of stairs.

props.synopsis: As the Paris Olympics enter full swing, there are warnings in Australia about the prevalence of problem gambling over the course of the Games, with the SA government also sounding the alarm about the number of children accessing betting apps.

title.children: With the Olympics underway, people struggling with gambling are being asked to seek help

image.altText: A young woman.

props.synopsis: Jamie Leonard weighed 35 kilograms and felt like there was cement in her chest when she was misdiagnosed with an eating disorder. In reality, she had a rare swallowing disorder and says she wasn't being listened to by doctors.

title.children: Jamie was wrongly diagnosed with an eating disorder. She says specialists weren't listening to her

image.altText: Bev Priestman speaks to the media during Canada's press conference in Melbourne

props.synopsis: The reigning gold medallists have copped a six point deduction, while three coaches, including Bev Priestman, have been banned for a year by FIFA.

title.children: FIFA deduct six points and ban three coaches after drone spying scandal at Olympics

image.altText: A road with palm trees along the side, and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Pacific Island nations are spending big to repay loans from China. But some say there are other roads available to them if they want to overcome their debt burdens.

title.children: Pacific Island nations owe 'astronomical' debts to China. Can they repay?

image.altText: A man in an army green t-shirt in a gym setting

props.synopsis: Gus Cooke took illegal anabolic steroids for more than a decade and he doesn't recommend their use. A new drug-checking trial aims to minimise harm among steroid users.

title.children: This powerlifting coach has taken performance-enhancing drugs for most of his adult life. He doesn't recommend it

image.altText: A suburban street with bushland on the right.

props.synopsis: Police attempted to taser the man before shooting him. Attempts to revive him with CPR were unsuccessful.

title.children: Man shot dead by police in Sydney's south-west after allegedly striking officer with a knife

image.altText: Maxwell Nugent in an defence force uniform in front of a plane, his arms crossed and smiling

props.synopsis: A year on from a helicopter crash that killed four Australian Defence Force members, loved ones are still questioning how a training drill turned into tragedy.

title.children: Families still fight for memorials to honour airmen a year on from fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: A man covered in dust holds a cloth to his nose as he walks through people to a medical unit

props.synopsis: The Israeli army struck parts of the humanitarian zone in central Gaza, where it said Hamas was operating a "command and control centre".

title.children: Israeli strike kills 30 in central Gaza as safe zone evacuated

image.altText: A line of people

props.synopsis: Electrical Trades Union members have walked out of the New South Wales Labor Party conference in Sydney as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese delivered a speech to party faithful.

title.children: Union members walk out on Albanese's speech at NSW Labor conference

image.altText: A photo of an older gentleman smiling with grey hair and mustache in a brown and gold frame.

props.synopsis: Frank de Jong took himself to the emergency department of a major Tasmanian hospital for some tests; not long after that he was sent home where he died just hours later. Frank's grieving family want accountability from the hospital — and they are not alone, with many chasing answers.

title.children: 'We trusted the health professionals': Family's anguish over hospital death with answers just not coming

image.altText: a spread of freshly sliced meat, seafood and veggies surround a bubbling pot of chilli broth

props.synopsis: Lemon chicken and sweet and sour pork used to be some of Australia's favourite Chinese foods but new crowd-pleasers such as beef noodles and spicy hotpot are changing the food scene.

title.children: ‘Why do we have to pay to cook our own hotpot?’: The changing Chinese food scene in Australia
